channel.title: [667/7**] Objects Providing Multiple Teleports
channel.description:
Hey,
So I've been wanting to make it so when I click on an object (I.E: A portal) it comes up with a dialogue box, providing multiple teleports. I've done this on 317 but I haven't done it on 667 nor do I remember exactly how, so could anyone help me out a bit? I have a general idea on how to.
Thanks.

item.title: [667/7**] Objects Providing Multiple Teleports
item.dc:creator: @ford_rock99 ford rock99
item.description:
@ford_rock99 wrote:

hey mate, i was just searching around for stuff and found this, not sure if u have found help on this yet, but pretty much u need to make a file.

call it. Portal.java

Add this into your java file. the rest you will have to figure out, I’m sure if your well with java u will know how to complete this.

also what ever you decide to name the java file wether it be, portal.java/apples.java/piglet.java you always have to change the coding inside,

public class “Portal” extends Dialogue the portal always needs to be named as the java file, but without the .java ofcause.

[code=javascript]package com.rs.game.player.dialogues;

import com.rs.game.WorldTile;

public class Portal extends Dialogue {

@Override
public void start() {
	sendDialogue(SEND_2_OPTIONS, "Question of your choice.",
			"Option of YES/NO", "Option of YES/NO");
}

public void run(int interfaceId, int componentId) {
	if (interfaceId == SEND_2_OPTIONS && componentId == 1) {
		player.setNextWorldTile(new WorldTile(0123, 0123, 0)); // Change/add more Co-ordinates
			sendDialogue(SEND_2_TEXT_CHAT, "",
					"Your Text Here",
					"Your Text Here");
		}
	}

@Override
public void finish() {

}

}[/code]

that’s the portal I’m working on atm, going to make it my teleport central. i hope this helped you, if you already new it well, i guess yeah idn haha gl mate.

EDIT - if u you need any further help on this, let me no i would be more then happy to help you out.

Read full topic
